intro: Rhinanthus glacialis subsp. humilis, commonly known as the alpine common tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes several parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This subspecies is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers. It typically thrives in open, sunny habitats such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. The plant plays a role in pollination and is adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of high-altitude ecosystems.
